values:
Sent/sending this week: Letters to Lene in Shropshire & Lisa in Austria and all my overseas Christmas cards!
Received: Letters from Sharon in Essex & Cathy in Northern Ireland.

Finally, I feel like I'm getting somewhere with my mail! I've written & sent a couple of letters already this week and the following will go out tomorrow: letters to Angela & Tammy in the USA, swap & letter to Mirjan in Holland, and various swaps via the yahoo groups I'm in & full FBs going home.

I still have to reply to the following (aaargghh!!!): Letters from Lene in Shropshire, Lisa in Austria, Sarah in Leicestershire, Allie in Bolton, Anna in Surrey, Eda in Estonia, Claudia in Holland, Lucie in the Czech Republic, Belinda in Austria, Andrea in North Wales, Saskia in Germany and Vicki in Somerset. THAT IS 12 WHOLE LETTERS!! MY HAND WILL DROP OFF!!! Please bear with me whilst I try to get up to date with everything. I may be some time. 

Hope all is well with everybody!

Hiya everyone! I just wanted to apologise for being such a crappy penpal lately and not keeping this updated or replying to letters or emails or anything like that.. As some of you know already, I am currently 9 weeks pregnant with baby #2 and having a really rough time at the moment. I'm sick constantly and spend far too much time asleep! So I have little energy for writing letters and my pile of mail I have to reply to is growing bigger and bigger.. I'm hoping that in the next couple of weeks, when I reach the second trimester, things will have improved and I'll be back to my normal letter writing self again, but in the meantime please bear with me and don't think I've forgotten about you!

I hope you're all happy & well!
x

PS: I forgot to mention - I have now stopped swapping normal FBs so please please please don't send me any more! I have been inundated these past couple of weeks! As a result, I have absolutely tons of excess that needs passing on so if you'd like any of them then let me know & I'd be happy to send them to you! I am now only swapping the neat booklet FBs through private swaps/yahoo groups and also mums only FBs. Thanks!

Sent: Swaps to Esther in the UK and Katka in Poland
Received: Letter from Caroline in Essex

Ha ha.. it made me laugh that I have intrigued a few of you (those that emailled me or left a comment here) with my comments about vomiting in the last entry!! I guess you will have to wait for my letters to find out the reasons why! :o)

Sent: Swap to Laura in Finland, letter to Jannicke in Norway
Received: Letter from Andrea in N Wales, swaps from Mirjan in Holland, Cynthia in Holland & Catharina in Denmark

Now if you'll excuse me, I must go vomit, hee hee! :o)

Sharon, I am in the middle of writing you a letter & am actually thinking of sending it in two parts as I have kept you waiting for it for so long! So hopefully I'll send the first half tomorrow & then the second half later on in the week. Gosh, how exciting!! :o)
Received: Letters from Kim in Cornwall & Cathy in Northern Ireland, letter & swap from Mirjan in Holland and swap from Joy in the USA! :o)

Sent: Letter to Vicki in Somerset, swap to Diana in Spain
Received: nothing at all.. sob sob sob sob sob sob sob sob sob sob...!!!

Yesterday I received a swap from Tanja in  Belgium and today I received lovely lovely labels from Sharon in Essex. Thank you so much, honeypie!! (Sorry, I think I'm turning into Granny Murray from Me Too! :o) )

Received: Letter from Jannicke in Norway, swaps from Yupa in Thailand and Danie in the UK somewhere but I can't remember where!
Sent: Letter to Cathy in Northern Ireland
Today I sent a letter to Tammy in the USA and received one from Andrea in North Wales. So there! :o)

Hello everyone! Hope you are having a great weekend! Over the past couple of days I've received letters from Eda in Estonia & Saskia in Germany. Thank you so much, my dears! :o) Then I have the following all sealed up and ready to send tomorrow or Monday: letter to Angela in the USA, labels order to Sharon in Essex and swaps to Lisa in Finland and Caroline in Staffordshire. That is all! :o)
Over the past couple of days I've received a letter from Sharon in Essex and FBs from Laura in Finland. And I've been a complete lazy ass and haven't sent out anything at all! So there! :o)

Received: Letter from Jenni in Worcestershire, FBs from Kathrin in Germany & Joy in the USA
Sent: Letters to Lene in Shropshire and Andrea in Wales

Yesterday I posted a letter to Caroline in Essex and tomorrow I'll post letters to Belinda in Austria & Lisa, also in Austria! Can you believe, I have received NO MAIL AT ALL since Tuesday!!! I'm suffering withdrawl symptoms, shakes, dizziness etc! If there is no mail for me still tomorrow I will probably have some kind of breakdown! It is really so traumatic for me! So if you owe me mail then hurry up and write it, you lazy bums, hee hee! :o)
Yesterday I got letters from Vicki in Somerset and Allie in Bolton and I sent a letter to Sharon in Essex & FBs to Astrid in Germany and Sherry in the USA. Today I got no mail at all, dammit! :o)

Phew! I've just spent the good part of an hour sorting out all my FBs and getting rid of the excess Sharon sent me!! So as well as the mail I mentioned yesterday, today I'll also be sending out FBs to Tanja in Belgium, Natasha in the Ukraine, Rachel in Newcastle Under Lyme, Morwenna in Sheffield, Hazel in Newark and Tara in Doncaster. Oh and about 5 minutes ago I received letters from Cathy in Northern Ireland and Andrea in Wrexham. So there you go! :o)

Hello! Look! It's me! I'm back! I had a lovely holiday but am rather braindead now as we got back at 4am this morning. I really really really did not want to come home - why can't life be one eternal holiday?!!! 

Anyway, waiting for me when I got home were FBs from Tanja in Belgium & Sharon in Essex and letters from Tammy and Angela, both in the USA. I managed to get a few letters out the way whilst I was away & will be sending them out tomorrow to Kim in Cornwall, Anna in Surrey and Mirjan in Holland. Sharon, I am in the process of writing you a novel & will try to get it finished over the next few days! :o) 

Hope you're all doing marvellously! :o)

Received: Letter from Sharon in Essex
Later on today I'll send out the following: Letters to Cathy in Northern Ireland and Claudia in Holland, FBs to Mirjan in Holland, Natasha in the Ukraine and Anne Marit in Norway

By the way, we leave for holiday tomorrow! Woohoo! So I won't be able to post about what mail I've received until we get back, which will be a week on Sunday (17th). I have no idea how I'm gonna cope without post for so long.. oh life is so hard sometimes..!!! :o) 

Hope everyone is happy & well! :o)

Oh my gosh, I have just discovered this really exciting thing! (Well, I guess it's only exciting if you live in the UK!) (and possibly only if you're sad like I am!), but on the Royal Mail website you can actually buy stamps and print them off online! Which means you need never queue up at the horrible old post office ever again! Unfortunately you do have to type the senders name onto the label that you print off, which means that all your envelopes will look a bit official like and boring, and also your pals that receive them may think that they're being sent a court summons or something because the address is so official looking, but still.. I think it's a small price to pay for not having to go to the post office!! Website is here!
